intro: Micranthes flabellifolia, commonly known as the fan-leaved pearly everlasting, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pale pink, bloom in late spring to early summer. Micranthes flabellifolia is often found in open woodlands and along stream banks, where it contributes to the local biodiversity.
